item.description:
An acclaimed photographer with the eye of a filmmaker, Gregory Crewdson has created some of the most gorgeously haunting pictures in the history of the medium.

His meticulously composed, large-scale images are stunning narratives of small-town American life: moviescapes crystallized into a single frame.

 

 

Gregory Crewdson: Brief Encounters, a film by Ben Shapiro, was shot over a decade with unprecedented access to the photographer. It beautifully bares the artist’s process—and it’s as mesmerizing and riveting as the images themselves.

Brief Encounters documents Crewdson's 10-year quest to create a series of haunting, surreal, and stunningly elaborate portraits of Americana.

Presented by 3S Artspace and the Portsmouth Public Library.

Screening will begin at 7pm.

This event is free and open to the public.

Drinks afterward, of course!

Official Selection: SWSW Film Festival, Newport Film Festival, Savannah Film Festival, Woods Hole Film Festival, Boston Independent Film Festival, NY Times Critics Pick.

Crewdson’s imagery has also infiltrated the pop culture landscape—including his inimitable Six Feet Under ads and Yo La Tengo album art.

While the photographs are staged with crews that rival many feature-film productions, Crewdson takes inspiration as much from his own dreams and fantasies as the worlds of Alfred Hitchcock, David Lynch, Edward Hopper and Diane Arbus.

“My pictures are about a search for a moment—a perfect moment. To me the most powerful moment in the whole process is when everything comes together and there is that perfect, beautiful, still moment. And for that instant, my life makes sense.”
- Gregory Crewdson

Click for FILM WEBSITE and Movie Trailer

item.name: FILM! Gregory Crewdson: Brief Encounters
